TitleNameInstitute
Principal InvestigatorJoseph DeRisi, PhDHoward Hughes Medical Institute, University of California, San Francisco, USA
Funding Source8 KL2TR000143-08National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences (NCATS), National Institutes of Health, Bethesda, MD, USA
Configuration.StudyNameEntrez: Metagenomic Deep Sequencing in Meningitis and Encephalitis
Configuration.StudyNameReportPage: Metagenomic Deep Sequencing in Meningitis and Encephalitis
Configuration.Description: This is a prospective observational study seeking to identify pathogens in cases of unexplained neurological disease, particularly those in which there is a presumed infectious cause. This next generation analytical approach will hopefully allow for rapid identification of foreign genomic material, and through a sophisticated bioinformatics pipeline developed in the DeRisi lab, these foreign genomic sequences can be aligned to all known sequences in publicly available databases (i.e. GenBank) which may allow for identification of novel pathogens or known pathogens that are not frequently tested for as part of standard diagnostic work-ups.
Configuration.StudyInEx:
Inclusion criterion:
Unexplained neurologic syndrome that may have an infectious or autoimmune cause in either an adult or child.

Exclusion criterion:
Prisoner

ParticipantSet.UseLimitation: Use of the data must be related to Neurological Disorders Research. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
